mdRecord.dcterms:title: Casa Navas, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Doménech y Montaner, Luis (Spanish architect, 1849-1923) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The building had a tower on the left facade, but it was destroyed by the bombing of dictator Franco during the Spanish Civil War and never rebuilt. Inside the building is a very wide and brightly lit space. Marble works were done by Alfons Juyol i Bach, the paintings by Tomàs Bergadà, the furniture by Gaspar Homar and the ceramics by Hipòlit Montseny; all of them under the instructions of Lluís Domènech i Montaner. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casa_Nav%C3%A0s [work]
